intro: Epirixanthes linearis, commonly known as the linear leaf epirixanthes, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or mountainous regions. It has a compact growth habit and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance. Epirixanthes linearis is a member of the Campanulaceae family, which includes other genera such as Bellis and Campanula.
